H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1576.def: = action by which humans act towards other humans or deities in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H8463.def: = state in which humans lack physical strength; ◄ caused by sickness or injury

H5849.def: = action by which humans or deities place themselves around other humans or groups of people; ► either to attack or to protect

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H2318.def: = causative action by which humans restore an object to make it function again in the way it has functioned before

H5404.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H5949.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7349.def: = state in which deities feel compassion for humans, ► which is usually translated into action

H2587.def: = state in which deities are favorably disposed to someone, or of experiencing an emotion of compassion towards other people, and acting accordingly

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H5201.def: = causative action by which humans make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2399.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

H1580.def: = causative process by which a mother causes her baby to become accustomed to food other than its mother's milk

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H1361.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1396.def: = process by which humans gain strength, power, and authority, which enables them to do things that others are unable to accomplish

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H4217.def: literally: the rising  (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4628.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H7355.def: = state in which humans feel affection for others

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3336.def: = an object produced by humans or deities, ◄ described as an artifact shaped from clay by an artisan

H587.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6692.def: = process by which a plant produces flowers in the spring as a precursor to the plant's fruit; ≈ associated with strength, prosperity, and splendor

H6731.def: = flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H3678.def: = large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H4438.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H4475.def: = state in which humans or, by extension, celestial bodies, are in a high position of authority over others

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation
